key_finding: BERT CV=4.0% vs literature 20% (compression factor 5.0x). At CV=20%, H contributes 8.5% of Var(log DEI), rank ρ=0.950
impact_on_conclusion: Low — E dominance robust even under decompression

key_finding: Controls R²=0.077, DEI rank ρ=0.9986, tier agreement=94.9%, mean |rank shift|=1.6
impact_on_conclusion: Low — rankings essentially unchanged after controls

key_finding: DEI vs DEI-N rank ρ=0.931, 3D Pareto frontier: 18 dishes (vs 11 original), NDI range [1.0, 22.3]
impact_on_conclusion: Medium — nutritionally dense meats gain ranks; Pareto set more balanced
new_data_columns: NDI, log_NDI, log_DEI_N, meal_role, protein_g, etc.

key_finding: 13 functional categories, within-category H contribution avg 1.0% (vs 0.3% global), 1,980 nutrition-constrained substitutions
impact_on_conclusion: Medium — within-category results confirm global pattern

key_finding: 15 dish families, global mean α=-0.055 (spending more E yields negligible H gain), most families: first 50% of E captures 80%+ of H range
